result.execSummary:
The defendant Jolene A. Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jolene A. Garcia is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jolene A. Garcia was found guilty of Aggravated Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(4).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.
** Pay restituiton plus surcharges.  May Not have contact with Martha Miller or Andrew Gonzales or Cody Herman unless other wise permitted by the court only.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes: Huber allowed. Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.  Credit for 2 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and statement given by victim in court.  Sentencing arguments are made.   Count 1 -  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 120 days in the KCJ commencing on 8/29/15 at 8:00 AM with credit for 2 days served.  Huber & Work Crew authorized.  Parties stipulate to restitution in the amount of $2934.55.  No contact with Martha M., Andrew G., or Cody H.  Cash Bond on deposit shall be applied to any costs and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.   Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Sentencing hearing on August 13, 2015 at 10:30 am.
$2000 deposited on 6/11/15
Amended Info

Count 1 - Plea of no contest; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 7/7/15 at 3:00.  $1,500.00 cash bond (posted) is modified to $2,000.00 cash bond with same conditions.  Def. needs to post $500.00 to be released from jail.
